ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  Fjodor
Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  He was very responsive whenever I needed help
Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  Fjodor - very helpful and interactive. Good support.
Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  I did not interact at all with the teaching fellow

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  The TA often times was not very well prepared for the assignments given and was hesitant as to what needs to be done.
Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  Fidor was good at responding to any questions I had regarding assignments.
Instructor: Fjodor Melnikov  There was no opportunity to learn anything from the TA. The instructions to homework are not clear.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I chosen this class as the fourth class to balance with other heavier ones, knowing that this is a light class and that past reviews are not positive. After spending many hours preparing the final exam but the exam questions turned out to be badly designed (There were 9 questions (8 questions to be exact since question 7 is missing, with 3 questions testing the same concept) and the final term paper topic is undefined (basically you can write whatever you want regarding environmental risk assessment), I regret having taking this class. I felt that I should have taken a class that I really enjoying attending and that has light homework like this one.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The best part was the final paper where we got to explore a risk assessment of any topic of our choice.
The Professor himself is a nice, easy-going person. He is flexible with exam dates But you don't really learn environmental risk assessment from this class.
The policy analysis in the course was in my view the best aspect of it.The case studies were equally important.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More focus on actual techniques for risk assessment. Introduction of some practical exercises with different models for risk assessment. The theoretical knowledge about different energy sources is not very related to risk assessment and was a non-necessary to many of the students in the class.

The subject of the course extremely required practical application. There should be practical classes to exercise the methods discussed during classes. This course would be much more useful if it had a more hands on approach, instead of being only just theory based. At least that was my expectation before taking it.
The course really needs improvement in training students on software that is used to train individuals in risk assessment.

There should be COMPULSORY readings for EVERY lecture session. This course is extremely important and hence need to be made more rigorous. The assignments should be designed in a way that students are tested how well the concepts taught in class have been understood. Assignments must try and cover ALL the topics learned in the class. And in such case assignments consisting of literature reviews are NOT of much use. Each assignment should have multiple practical questions and should be more challenging that students need to learn the ERA techniques really well. There should either be a final exam or a paper. Having both at the end of the semester makes it difficult. Avoid having only literature reviews as assignments/ exams. It does not help in learning ERA tools and techniques which are more mathematical or methodical in nature. In syllabus, include the readings for each class. Upload the material on Classes V2, date and class wise, else it gets confusing. Stick to the syllabus and ERA concepts.Energy technologies and LCA are covered in other courses hence total focus of this course should be "Risk" assessment.
This class should really teach Environmental Risk Assessment in a way that is relevant to students' future job. The current syllabus design is not well thought through.
I think the use of different softwares on data analysis should be considered with a view to expanding more on them.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: More focus on actual readings. The class presentations were not enough to give the necessary context. There can be different cases to read so that students can see the trade offs and the cost : both financial and social to risk mitigation.
The relationship between the course and the discussions were effective but it could be improved with more case studies

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The class has given me the language needed in consulting but I feel I could have learned more had we had a practical component to the class.

The course fitted into my overall program. It completed my legal understanding of issues related to risks assessment, responsibilities and ways to mitigate risk. The course was equally important for my work on environmental policy

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Risk assessment is an important part of work in any operations/facility management structure. I wanted to learn more on how to apply this knowledge to real world challenges.
To understand what goes into environmental risk assessment (energy, natural resources etc)
I wanted to take a lighter class and I was interested in environmental risk assessment because it's such an important topic. Unfortunately, I failed in learning about ESA from the class.
I took this course because I wanted to have a very good understanding of how environmental risks are generated and mitigated.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Not really. I am not confident to say that I am familiar with models for risk assessment and mitigation, which I expected to have an understanding of at course completion. I am vaguely familiar with basic concepts such as event trees and fault trees analysis.
Not really.
It met my broad expectations but it did not give me the hard skills of risk assessment. I got soft skills.
Yes
No.
Yes, the course met my expectations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it!

If they have engineering background, they will probably be able to take out more of the course. Other than that the course is interesting, the work load is not very heavy so it can be a nice add on during an otherwise heavy loaded semester.
I won't recommend.
You probably know the reviews to this class already. Think twice!
I would advise any student interested in this course to be prepared for more reading and familiarity with some mathematical thinking, which the instructor is very much interested in.
